      • getTypeString

        public abstract java.lang.String getTypeString()
        Returns the string denoting this type, e.g. "int", "bool".

      • defaultValue

        public java.lang.Object defaultValue()
        Returns the default value for this type, assuming no initialisation specified.

      • canAssign

        public boolean canAssign(Type type)
        Returns true iff a variable of this type can be assigned a value that is of type type.

      • castValueTo

        public java.lang.Object castValueTo(java.lang.Object value)
                             throws PrismLangException
        Make sure that a value, stored as an Object (Integer, Boolean, etc.) is of this type. Basically, implement some implicit casts, e.g. Integer -> Double. This should only only work for combinations of types that satisfy #canAssign(Type). If not, an exception is thrown (but such problems should have been caught earlier by type checking)
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • castFromBigRational

        public java.lang.Object castFromBigRational(BigRational value)
                                     throws PrismLangException
        Cast a BigRational value to the Java data type (Boolean, Integer, Double, ...) corresponding to this type.
        For boolean and integer, this throws an exception if the value can not be precisely represented by the Java data type; for double, loss of precision is expected and does not raise an exception.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
